questions.question: The unit of electrical energy is

explanations.a: kWh is a commercial unit of energy.
explanations.b: Joule is the SI unit of energy.
explanations.c: Electron volt is used in atomic-scale energy measurements.
explanations.d: All are valid units of electrical energy.

questions.question: The production of emf by maintaining a difference of temperature between the two junctions of two dissimilar metals is called

explanations.a: Joule's effect refers to heat produced by current, not emf generation.
explanations.b: Peltier effect is the reverse of Seebeck, related to heat absorption/release.
explanations.c: Seebeck effect is the correct term for emf generation due to temperature difference.
explanations.d: Thomson effect involves heat flow in a single conductor with a temperature gradient.

questions.question: Thermo emf of a thermocouple depends on

answers.a: the nature of the material used
answers.b: the temperature of the cold junction
answers.c: the temperature of the hot junction

explanations.a: Different metal combinations produce different thermoelectric effects.
explanations.b: The emf depends on the reference (cold) junction temperature.
explanations.c: The emf also depends on the hot junction temperature.
explanations.d: All the above factors influence the thermo emf.
